H0.text: Sediments are being deposited is most likely indicated by land subsidence (ground level dropping).

H1.text: Water is being polluted is the most likely indication that land subsidence (ground level dropping) is occurring.

H2.text: Rocks are being weathered is the most likely indication that land subsidence (ground level dropping) is occurring.

H3.text: Ground water is being depleted when land subsidence, meaning ground level dropping, is most likely an indication that.

A4.text: Dissolution of limestone by fluid flow in the subsurface creates voids (i.e., caves). If the roof of a void becomes too weak, it can collapse and the overlying rock and earth will fall into the space, causing subsidence at the surface.

A5.text: Groundwater-related subsidence is the sinking of land resulting from groundwater extraction.
